author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bhanoth Anitha, who was brutally beaten up on Monday by her husband’s first wife Swaroopa and relatives, was forced to terminate her pregnancy due to severe injuries.

Following physical assault, the baby died in the womb at Government Maternity Hospital, Hanamkonda.

Anitha, who suffered 15 per cent of burn injuries, was stated to be out of danger.

Collector Vakati Karuna and Police Commissioner G. Sudheer Babu called on her late last night at the hospital and assured her of all support. A police picket had been set up and patrolling intensified in Donga Chintha thanda and in surrounding hamlets where she was abused and assaulted.

Anitha had to face the fury of relatives of her husband Bhanot Ravi too for marrying him despite knowing that he was already married.

Speaking to The Hindu , he said six of the nine accused were arrested and sent to judicial remand, while the remaining are still at large.

The Commissioner said that the victim was not stripped and paraded as reported in the media but was manhandled badly by the accused.
title: Assaulted Telangana woman gives birth to still born child
